thread.title: Pence Tells March For Life Crowd Trump Will Announce Supreme Court Pick Next Week
thread.title_full: Pence Tells March For Life Crowd Trump Will Announce Supreme Court Pick Next Week

author: Jeff Neukom
title: Pence Tells March For Life Crowd Trump Will Announce Supreme Court Pick Next Week
text:
Pence Tells March For Life Crowd Trump Will Announce Supreme Court Pick Next Week "... will uphold the God-given liberties enshrined in our Constitution ..." by Jeff Neukom January 27, 2017 at 12:10pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Speaking at the 44th annual March For Life, Vice President Mike Pence announced that President Donald Trump next week will nominate a judge to the Supreme Court who will uphold Americans’“God-given liberties.” 
Pence told the tens of thousands gathered at the National Mall in Washington, D.C., that the Supreme Court turned away from the founding values of the country with its decision in Roe vs. Wade in 1973. 
“That’s why next week, President Donald Trump will announce a Supreme Court nominee who will uphold the God-given liberties enshrined in our Constitution in the provision of the late and great Antonin Scalia,” he said. Advertisement - story continues below Report: Downtown D.C. Hotels Sold Record Number Of Rooms For Trump Inauguration 
Pence did not reveal a name or even a list of front-runners, though his earlier comments indicate the nominee will be a strict constructionist — a judge who applies the Constitution and other text as it is written, rather than seeking to enact legislation through his or her rulings. 
“President Trump has been reviewing that list” of potential nominees, he told Republican lawmakers Thursday. “I can already tip you off: President Trump’s going to keep his promise to the American people and he’s going to nominate a strict constructionist to the Supreme Court.” 
Trump reportedly has narrowed the list to three candidates: Neil Gorsuch, a judge on 10th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals based in Denver; Judge William H. Pryor Jr. of Alabama, who serves on 11th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals based in Atlanta; and Judge Thomas Hardiman of Pittsburgh, who serves on the 3rd U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals. Advertisement - story continues below 
Pence praised the president for upholding promises made during the election, saying Trump has “energy” and a “big heart.” 
“I like to say over there at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue, we’re in the promise-keeping business,” he said. 
Pence’s participation marked the first time a vice president has ever appeared in person at the March for Life, which draws hundreds of thousands of pro-life demonstrators each year. Advertisement - story continues below
